basics.name: Ben McEwen
basics.label: Postdoctoral Researcher
basics.summary: Audio machine learning researcher with a focus on bioacoustics and uncertainty quantification. I am passionate about using machine learning to solve real-world problems, particularly in the field of biodiversity conservation.

work.name: Audio Machine Learning and Bioacoustics, Tilburg University
work.summary: Postdoctoral researcher in the field of AI and biodiversity, focusing on the application of machine learning techniques to ecological data.

publications.name: Computational Bioacoustics for the Detection of Rare Acoustic Events (thesis)
publications.summary: PhD dissertation related to the monitoring of rare acoustic events (particularly invasive species in New Zealand). This work explores the use of active few-shot learning for rare event annotation and well as prior research related to environmental noise and predictive tracking.

publications.name: Active Few-Shot Learning for Rare Bioacoustic Feature Annotation
publications.summary: Present a methodology that integrates few-shot learning and active learning for efficient analysis of sparse features

publications.name: An Improved Computational Bioacoustic Monitoring Approach for Detecting Sparse Features

references.name: Associate Professor Dan Stowell
references.reference: Machine listening and computational bioacoustics. Associate Professor of AI & Biodiversity at Tilburg University and Naturalis Biodiversity Center

references.name: Professor Stefanie Guschmidt
references.reference: Leads the Dynamics Systems lab and co-lead of the Listening Lab. Head of the Department of Mechanical Engineering at the University of Canterbury

projects.name: Listening Lab
projects.summary: A multidisciplinary research group developing computational bioacoustic tools for conservation

projects.name: Evaluation & Benchmarking in Automated Bioacoustics (BioDCASE)
projects.summary: Build and maintain the BioDCASE Website, a community-driven initiative to evaluate and benchmark bioacoustic methods.
